get.summary: Gets a list of OpenShift managed clusters in the specified subscription.
get.description: Gets a list of OpenShift managed clusters in the specified subscription. The operation returns properties of each OpenShift managed cluster.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client Api Version.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

get.summary: Lists OpenShift managed clusters in the specified subscription and resource group.
get.description: Lists OpenShift managed clusters in the specified subscription and resource group. The operation returns properties of each OpenShift managed cluster.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client Api Version.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

get.description: Gets the details of the managed OpenShift cluster with a specified resource group and name.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client Api Version.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The name of the OpenShift managed cluster resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the cluster doesn't exist, 404 (Not found) is returned.

put.summary: Creates or updates an OpenShift managed cluster.
put.description: Creates or updates a OpenShift managed cluster with the specified configuration for agents and OpenShift version.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client Api Version.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The name of the OpenShift managed cluster resource.

requestBody.description: Parameters supplied to the Create or Update an OpenShift Managed Cluster operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the cluster doesn't exist, 404 (Not found) is returned.If any of the input parameters is wrong, 400(Bad Request) is returned.

delete.description: Deletes the OpenShift managed cluster with a specified resource group and name.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client Api Version.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The name of the OpenShift managed cluster resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.summary: Updates tags on an OpenShift managed cluster.
patch.description: Updates an OpenShift managed cluster with the specified tags.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client Api Version.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The name of the OpenShift managed cluster resource.

requestBody.description: Parameters supplied to the Update OpenShift Managed Cluster Tags operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the cluster doesn't exist, 404 (Not found) is returned. If any of the input parameters is wrong, 400(Bad Request) is returned.

CloudError.description: An error response from the Container service.

code.description: An identifier for the error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

details.description: A list of additional details about the error.

message.description: A message describing the error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

target.description: The target of the particular error. For example, the name of the property in error.

CloudErrorBody.description: An error response from the Container service.

peerVnetId.description: CIDR of the Vnet to peer.

OSType.description: OsType to be used to specify os type. Choose from Linux and Windows. Default to Linux.

OpenShiftAgentPoolProfileRole.description: OpenShiftAgentPoolProfileRole represents the role of the AgentPoolProfile.

OpenShiftManagedClusterAADIdentityProvid.description: Defines the Identity provider for MS AAD.

clientId.description: The clientId password associated with the provider.

secret.description: The secret password associated with the provider.

tenantId.description: The tenantId associated with the provider.

count.description: Number of agents (VMs) to host docker containers.

name.description: Unique name of the pool profile in the context of the subscription and resource group.

OpenShiftManagedClusterAgentPoolProfile.description: Defines the configuration of the OpenShift cluster VMs.

identityProviders.description: Type of authentication profile to use.

OpenShiftManagedClusterAuthProfile.description: Defines all possible authentication profiles for the OpenShift cluster.

OpenShiftManagedClusterIdentityProvider.description: Defines the configuration of the identity providers to be used in the OpenShift cluster.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of OpenShift managed cluster results.

value.description: The list of OpenShift managed clusters.

OpenShiftManagedClusterListResult.description: The response from the List OpenShift Managed Clusters operation.

count.description: Number of masters (VMs) to host docker containers. The default value is 3.

name.description: Unique name of the master pool profile in the context of the subscription and resource group.

OpenShiftManagedClusterMasterPoolProfile.description: OpenShiftManagedClusterMaterPoolProfile contains configuration for OpenShift master VMs.

fqdn.description: User-specified FQDN for OpenShift API server loadbalancer internal hostname.

openShiftVersion.description: Version of OpenShift specified when creating the cluster.

provisioningState.description: The current deployment or provisioning state, which only appears in the response.

publicHostname.description: Optional user-specified FQDN for OpenShift API server.

OpenShiftManagedClusterProperties.description: Properties of the OpenShift managed cluster.

fqdn.description: Auto-allocated FQDN for the OpenShift router.

product.description: Specifies the product of the image from the marketplace. This is the same value as Offer under the imageReference element.

PurchasePlan.description: Used for establishing the purchase context of any 3rd Party artifact through MarketPlace.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
